data.Title: Google Makes Changes to Search Console and AI Overviews
data.Description: Google has made several updates to Search Console, including cleaning up the data anomalies page and making it difficult to track AI Overviews.  SEOs are finding it challenging to analyze the impact of AI Overviews on click-through rates and traffic.

data.Title: Google Updates Policies on Google Ads, Maps, and Hreflang
data.Description: Google has updated several policies, including forcing some advertisers to switch from credit card payments to ACH/check/wire payments, updating the Maps contributor "fake engagement" policy, and clarifying the use of hreflang tags for alternate versions of a page.

data.Title: Google Allows Ads Discussing Opioid Painkillers
data.Description: Google Ads now permits advertisements that discuss opioid painkillers without promoting or selling them.

data.Title: Apple Updates Applebot Documentation
data.Description: Apple has updated its Applebot documentation, including information on Applebot-Extended, Reverse DNS, and additional user agents. The update follows the preview of Apple Intelligence at WWDC.

data.Title: TikTok Introduces AI Avatars for Ads
data.Description: TikTok is incorporating AI-generated avatars of creators and stock actors into its advertisements. These avatars, known as "Stock Avatars," are created using paid actors licensed for commercial use.

data.Title: YouTube Tests "Notes" Feature for Videos
data.Description: YouTube is piloting a new "Notes" feature, allowing viewers in the US to see notes on videos. The feature will initially be available on mobile devices and in English.

data.Title: Runway Unveils Gen-3 Alpha Text-to-Video Model
data.Description: Runway has released Gen-3 Alpha, an AI model capable of generating high-quality, realistic video clips up to 10 seconds long. The model builds upon the company's previous Gen-2 release and increases competition with OpenAI's Sora.

data.Title: GARM and Ad Net Zero Launch Carbon Emission Measurement Standards
data.Description: The Global Alliance for Responsible Media (GARM) and Ad Net Zero have introduced new standards for measuring carbon emissions in advertising. The standards currently cover TV, digital, and out-of-home advertising, with plans to expand to print, radio, and film.

data.Title: Consumers Skeptical of AI-Generated News
data.Description: A new report reveals that global audiences are wary of news produced with the assistance of AI. Despite this skepticism, consumers remain reluctant to pay for news content.

data.Title: TikTok's Growth as a Discovery Platform
data.Description: An Adobe survey highlights TikTok's increasing role as a discovery platform, particularly among Gen Z users. The survey found that nearly 1 in 10 Gen Z respondents were more likely to use TikTok than Google for search.

data.Title: Google Chrome to Introduce AI-Powered Search Feature
data.Description: Google is developing an AI-driven search feature for its Chrome browser that will analyze users' browsing history to provide more relevant results. The feature has raised privacy concerns.

data.Title: Microsoft and OpenAI Rivalry Intensifies
data.Description: Microsoft's AI chief has been examining OpenAI's code, highlighting the growing competition between the two companies in the AI field.

data.Title: OpenAI Considers Shift to For-Profit Model
data.Description: OpenAI is reportedly contemplating a transition to a for-profit benefit corporation. The move could pave the way for an initial public offering (IPO) for the company, currently valued at $86 billion.
